meanings.sent1: The bitted horse had a comfortable ride.

meanings.definition: To put a bit in the mouth of (a horse)
meanings.sent1: The rider bitted the horse before the race.
meanings.sent2: She bitted the new horse gently to gain its trust.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous foal tried to avoid being bitted.
meanings.sent4: He bitted the horse with care, ensuring its comfort.
meanings.sent5: The trainer bitted the stallion expertly, showing skill and patience.

meanings.definition: To control or restrain with a bit
meanings.sent1: The experienced rider bitted the spirited horse effectively.
meanings.sent2: She bitted the horse firmly to prevent it from running off.
meanings.sent3: The playful colt was not easily bitted during training.
meanings.sent4: He bitted the horse with authority, gaining its respect.
meanings.sent5: The trainer bitted the mare gently, earning her trust and cooperation.
